verses.verse: (Thanksgiving for Deliverance from Death) I (Ps. 18:1) love the LORD, because He has heard My voice and my supplications.
Because He has inclined His ear to me, Therefore I will call upon Him as long as I live.
(Ps. 18:4-6) The pains of death surrounded me, And the pangs of Sheol laid hold of me; I found trouble and sorrow.
Then I called upon the name of the LORD: “O LORD, I implore You, deliver my soul!”
((Ps. 103:8)) Gracious is the LORD, and ((Ezra 9:15); Neh. 9:8; (Ps. 119:137; 145:17; Jer. 12:1; Dan. 9:14)) righteous; Yes, our God is merciful.
The LORD preserves the simple; I was brought low, and He saved me.
Return to your ((Jer. 6:16; Matt. 11:29)) rest, O my soul, For (Ps. 13:6) the LORD has dealt bountifully with you.
(Ps. 56:13) For You have delivered my soul from death, My eyes from tears, And my feet from falling.
I will walk before the LORD (Ps. 27:13) In the land of the living.
(2 Cor. 4:13) I believed, therefore I spoke, “I am greatly afflicted.”
(Ps. 31:22) I said in my haste, (Rom. 3:4) “All men are liars.”
What shall I render to the LORD For all His benefits toward me?
I will take up the cup of salvation, And call upon the name of the LORD.
(Ps. 116:18) I will pay my vows to the LORD Now in the presence of all His people.
(Ps. 72:14; (Rev. 14:13)) Precious in the sight of the LORD Is the death of His saints.
O LORD, truly (Ps. 119:125; 143:12) I am Your servant; I am Your servant, (Ps. 86:16) the son of Your maidservant; You have loosed my bonds.
I will offer to You (Lev. 7:12; Ps. 50:14; 107:22) the sacrifice of thanksgiving, And will call upon the name of the LORD.
I will pay my vows to the LORD Now in the presence of all His people,
In the (Ps. 96:8) courts of the LORD’s house, In the midst of you, O Jerusalem. Praise the LORD!
